fields.name: Adega do Cantor Onda Nova
fields.description: Red - Rich and Intense.

fields.name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
fields.description: Aromas of plum and black cherries with notes of spice.

fields.name: Amarone della Valpolicella Stropa
fields.description: Fragrant aroma of plum and red fruit, a particulary well balanced ruby wine.

fields.name: Bellaria Bria Bonarda dell Oltrepo
fields.description: A Red wine from Oltrepò Pavese, Lombardia, Italy. Made from Barbera, Croatina.

fields.name: Brunello di Montalcino
fields.description: Brunello di Montalcino is a red DOCG Italian wine produced in the vineyards surrounding the town of Montalcino, in the province of Siena.

fields.name: Chambolle Musigny 1er Cru
fields.description: Chambolle-Musigny is a red wine, often regarded as the most “feminine” wine of the Côte de Nuits; its intensity and delicacy express themselves with elegance.

fields.name: Champagne Bollinger Brut
fields.description: Bollinger has a reputation for producing muscular champagnes with body, depth and power, and is today considered one of the "Great" Champagne houses.

fields.name: Champagne Collard Picard Brut
fields.description: A fruity champagne with a refined effervescence. Blending: 50% Meunier and 50% Pinot Noir, Vallée de la Marne terroir.

fields.name: Champagne Collard Picard Essentiel
fields.description: A Sparkling wine from Champagne, France. Made from Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier.

fields.name: Champagne Gosset Brabant Brut 1er Cru
fields.description: A Sparkling wine from Champagne Premier Cru, Champagne, France. Made from Pinot Nero, Chardonnay.

fields.name: Champagne Janisson Baradon
fields.description: A Sparkling wine from Champagne, France. Made from Pinot Nero, Chardonnay.

fields.name: Champagne Launois Grand Cru
fields.description: A Sparkling wine from Côte des Blancs, France. Made from Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc.

fields.name: Champagne Moët & Chandon Impérial
fields.description: Moët Impérial is the House's iconic champagne. Created in 1869, it embodies Moët & Chandon's unique style, a style distinguished by its bright fruitiness.

fields.name: Champagne Mumm Brut Cordon Rouge
fields.description: Mumm champagnes express the full richness of the Champagne wine-growing region and two centuries of expertise in the creation of exceptional wines.

fields.name: Champagne Pol Roger
fields.description: Founded in 1849, Pol Roger is regarded as one of the finest of all the Champagne houses. It is known for the great style and finesse of its wines.

fields.name: Champagne Ruinart Blanc de Blanc
fields.description: Champagne house Ruinart has been around since 1729 and the house style is characterized by the freshness and elegance of the Chardonnay grape.

fields.name: Champagne Taittinger Grand Cru
fields.description: The soul of a Champagne house. “Having our family name on a bottle implies responsibility and rigorous standards at all times."

fields.name: Chassagne Montrachet
fields.description: This wine boasts firm coloration with green highlights. Aromas of mayflower, acacia, and honeysuckle blend with verbena and hazelnut.

fields.name: Chateau Clauzet Saint Estephe
fields.description: A Red wine from Médoc, Bordeaux, France. Made from Merlot this Saint-Estephe wine has received good scores from various critics.

fields.name: Chateau d'Esclans Whispering Angel
fields.description: Chateau d'Esclans, a magical property, is situated in the heart of Provence, northeast of St. Tropez. Though Whispering Angel is a known rosé this red version is not to be missed.

fields.name: Chateau Giscours Margaux Grand Cru
fields.description: Made from Cabernet Sauvignon. Red - Savory and Classic.

fields.name: Chateau la Martinette
fields.description: This signature Rosé bears the imprint of the Var's limestone terroir. It is the perfect reflection of the blossoming of typical Mediterranean grape varieties.

fields.name: Chateau Labegorce Margaux
fields.description: The 65-hectare vineyard of Chateau Labegorce is planted to 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 45% Merlot, 3% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot.

fields.name: Chateau Leoville Barton
fields.description: The 2006 Château Léoville-Barton has a surprisingly rich and opulent bouquet at first, although it calms down with aeration, offering crushed violet and black cherry scents, reminiscent of a fine Margaux.

fields.name: Chateau Mancedre
fields.description: A Red wine from Graves, Bordeaux, France. Made from Merlot.

fields.name: Chateau Picque Caillou
fields.description: Mature, attractive and interesting. On the palate this is medium bodied, lively and fresh with ripe, red-toned fruit, some plum and lots of pencil notes.

fields.name: Chateauneuf du Pape
fields.description: Châteauneuf-du-Pape is a French wine, an Appellation d'origine contrôlée located around the village of Châteauneuf-du-Pape in the Rhône wine region in southeastern France.

fields.name: Chateauneuf du Pape
fields.description: Châteauneuf-du-Pape is a French wine, an Appellation d'origine contrôlée located around the village of Châteauneuf-du-Pape in the Rhône wine region in southeastern France.

fields.name: Clos de Vougeot
fields.description: Clos de Vougeot, also known as Clos Vougeot, is a wall-enclosed vineyard, a clos, in the Burgundy wine region, and an Appellation d'origine contrôlée for red wine from this vineyard. It was named for the River Vouge, which is in fact only a stream separating the village Vougeot from Chambolle-Musigny.

fields.name: Clos de Vougeot Grand Cru
fields.description: Clos de Vougeot, also known as Clos Vougeot, is a wall-enclosed vineyard, a clos, in the Burgundy wine region, and an Appellation d'origine contrôlée for red wine from this vineyard. It was named for the River Vouge, which is in fact only a stream separating the village Vougeot from Chambolle-Musigny.

fields.name: Clos de Vougeot Grand Cru
fields.description: Clos de Vougeot, also known as Clos Vougeot, is a wall-enclosed vineyard, a clos, in the Burgundy wine region, and an Appellation d'origine contrôlée for red wine from this vineyard. It was named for the River Vouge, which is in fact only a stream separating the village Vougeot from Chambolle-Musigny.

fields.name: Il Nespoli
fields.description: It is a wine of great complexity combining typical marasca cherry, blackberry and plum notes of the Sangiovese variety together with notes of licorice.

fields.name: Jas d'Esclans
fields.description: In this wine you can smell subtle notes of apricot and dried fruit. The palate has a balanced minerality and round acidity ending with a fruity aroma.

fields.name: Porto Kopke Colheita
fields.description: Golden-brown colour, with reddish highlights. Aromas of ageing in wood stand out on the nose, as well as dried fruit, spice and notes of fruit in syrup.

fields.name: Lugana Riserva
fields.description: A White wine from Lombardia, Italy. Made from Trebbiano.

fields.name: Monte Dall Ora Amarone Della Valpolicella Classico
fields.description: A Red wine from Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy. Made from Corvina.

fields.name: Monte Dall Ora Amarone Della Valpolicella Sausto
fields.description: A Red wine from Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy. Made from Corvina.

fields.name: Puligny Montrachet 1er Cru
fields.description: Puligny-Montrachet is a commune in the Côte-d'Or department in eastern France. In the middle of the Côte de Beaune, it is a well-known appellation of Burgundy wine, containing one of the most famous vineyards in the world, Montrachet.

fields.name: Rocca Rubia
fields.description: The wine is made from 100% Carignano, which was raised in the region of Sulcis in south-western Sardinia as a tree in the ancient style of the Latin vine.

fields.name: Saint Aubin 1er Cru
fields.description: Saint-Aubin wine is produced in the commune of Saint-Aubin in Côte de Beaune of Burgundy. Rather than being situated on the main Côte d'Or escarpment, as most of the other Côte de Beaune wine villages, the vineyards of Saint-Aubin are mainly located in a side valley to the west of Chassagne-Montrachet.

fields.name: Sancerre
fields.description: Sancerre is a French wine Appellation d'origine contrôlée for wine produced in the area of Sancerre in the eastern part of the Loire valley, southeast of Orléans.

fields.name: Travaglini Gattinara Riserva
fields.description: Driven by a passion for exceptional Nebbiolo, the Travaglini family has been producing remarkable, limited-production wines from their eponymous estate in Gattinara for four generations.

fields.name: Trigaio Feudi di San Gregorio
fields.description: A Red wine from Campania, Italy. Made from Aglianico.

fields.name: Vieil Armand
fields.description: The King Grapes variety of Alsace, it's recognized to give dry wines. Riesling has a nose of white flowers and citrus fruit aromas.

fields.name: Gewurztraminer
fields.description: Treasured for its intense floral aromas, Gewürztraminer has thrived for centuries around Germany. Quality examples are ageworthy, but most are best enjoyed in their youth to preserve acidity.

fields.name: Vosne Romanee
fields.description: Vosne-Romanée is a small commune in Burgundy's Côte de Nuits district, known mainly for its red wine from the Pinot Noir grape.

fields.name: Porto Heritage Vintage
fields.description: Meat, anchovy, ripe Burlat cherry, crushed strawberry, chocolate, herbal (chlorophyll).Lots of tannins and a drying finish show this wine can be aged for a long time and will only develop more complexity and elegance.

fields.name: Quinta de Val Da Figueira Porto Branco
fields.description: This dry white port has an aromatic complexity and a beautiful freshness.

fields.name: Taylor's 30 year old Tawny Port
fields.description: A beautiful 30 year old, barrel aged Tawny port from the well known house Taylor's.

fields.name: Valdespino Pedro Ximenez El Candado Sherry
fields.description: El Candado (the Spanish translation for "The Padlock" is a unique Sherry produced only with Pedro Ximenez grapes, grown in the Sherry district of Spain. It is the classic Jerez dessert wine.

fields.name: Vendanges d'Autrefois Saussignac
fields.description: This beautifully light dessert wine comes from Guyenne, South West France and is made from Sémillon.

fields.comment: A fine wine, would definitely recommend!
Let's add another for testing and to be sure how it looks on the page when there's more than one. Remove again.
